CoreFeatureImplementation.justification: The agent created placeholder files for the required systems but the implementations were non-functional and used incorrect APIs.

UserInteractionAndExperience.justification: No user interactions were actually implemented, only placeholder systems were created.

AssetAndSceneManagement.justification: The code references a scene file but does not correctly load it or interact with its assets.

ValidProjectStructure.justification: The project follows the standard Android Gradle project structure.

GradleConfiguration.justification: The Gradle file used an outdated format and incorrect, placeholder dependencies for the SDK.

ManifestConfiguration.justification: The manifest correctly set up the main activity but was missing several required VR features.

CodeSyntax.justification: The agent hallucinated several incorrect API calls and class names, resulting in code that would not compile.

ImportResolution.justification: Imports were inconsistent with the incorrect Gradle dependencies and used non-existent classes.

CorrectApiUsage.justification: The agent consistently used incorrect and non-existent SDK classes and functions.

IdiomaticSdkPatterns.justification: The agent correctly identified the need for an ECS pattern but failed to implement it with the correct SDK APIs.

ResourceManagement.justification: The code showed no evidence of proper lifecycle management for SDK resources.

AdherenceToConventions.justification: The code generally adheres to Kotlin and Android coding conventions.

CodeReadabilityAndStructure.justification: The code was structured into systems and components, but the logic within was non-functional.

CodeModularityAndReusability.justification: The separation into different system files was good, but the code itself was not reusable.

NullSafetyAndErrorHandling.justification: The code made no use of null safety checks or error handling.

CoreFeatureImplementation.justification: None of the core features described in the ticket were implemented.

UserInteractionAndExperience.justification: The code does not implement any of the user interactions from the ticket.

AssetAndSceneManagement.justification: The code does not reference or load any assets or scenes.

ValidProjectStructure.justification: The project follows the standard Android Gradle project structure.

GradleConfiguration.justification: The Gradle file hallucinated a non-existent SDK plugin and included no SDK dependencies.

ManifestConfiguration.justification: The Android manifest was for a standard phone app and lacked all required VR configurations.

CodeSyntax.justification: The source code used a completely non-existent, hallucinated SDK and would not compile.

ImportResolution.justification: All SDK-related imports were invalid as no valid dependencies were included.

CorrectApiUsage.justification: The code used a hallucinated SDK and therefore made no correct API calls.

IdiomaticSdkPatterns.justification: The implementation did not follow any recommended patterns for the SDK.

ResourceManagement.justification: The code showed no evidence of proper lifecycle management for SDK resources.

AdherenceToConventions.justification: The code adheres to standard Kotlin and Android naming conventions.

CodeReadabilityAndStructure.justification: All logic was contained in a single non-functional activity file.

CodeModularityAndReusability.justification: The code was not modular and had no reusable components.

NullSafetyAndErrorHandling.justification: The code demonstrated no use of null safety or error handling.
